page.title: 04ATTITUDES - PEOPLE AND PETS
page.content: The class interviewed 316 households. They were asked if they liked pets. 68% replied that they did. 31% said they owned a dog. 20% declared that they owned a cat. 7% kept a budgerigar as a companion. 22% kept a miscellany of other pets. 61% of dog owners saw their pets as a security measure against burglary. People were asked why they had pets. Pets made good companions. They gave pleasure to owners. Walking the dog was good exercise. Children learnt to be responsible, kind and gentle in caring for animals. What problems were faced by owners? The difficulties were leaving them when on holiday. They could be expensive to keep, messy, noisy, cause road hazards and be destructive in house and garden.
